Ice:: 

She thought about what Lunarpine thought. She nodded. He was right. 
She straightened up her shoulders. She tried to sound more confident, 
even though she was scared out of her fur. "When we land, I'll talk 
to the leader and introduce ourselves." She just hoped her shaking 
wasn't so visible.  

She was trying to develope a plan of action, but it wasn't easy since 
she didn't know how the other bots would react. She looked out the 
window. "We're almost there. Lunarpine," tring to make her voice have 
a little more authority to it, but not by much," Call up the base and 
request permission to land."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Razor Claw was bewildered by the prospect that the leader was 
looking 
> for advice. "Whatever you command is our task to perform."
> 
> Lunarpine laughed. "Don't look at me. You're in charge. Hewas 
hopeing 
> she'd take charge and instruct them, instead she'd dropped the 
ball. 
> He thought to her, "Take charge, you have to be strong in front of 
> your troops." He knew her well enough to tell that it was just 
nerves 
> that held her back. Razor Claw didn't know her as well and the 
> Predacons frown upon a leader that has to ask for advice.
>
